LanguageData.HVMP_SettingChaosMode: E-branches issue quests on independent timers
LanguageData.HVMP_TooltipChaosMode:
Enterprise quests are issued to the player on a timer whose duration is set below. How the timer works is determined by this setting:

-If enabled, each e-branch issues quests based on its own timer.

-If disabled, there is one timer, and whenever it triggers only ONE e-branch will issue a quest.
LanguageData.HVMP_SettingMinDays: Min days between random e-branch quests
LanguageData.HVMP_TooltipMinDays: Each e-branch periodically offers a quest to the player. This is the minimum amount of time it takes to receive an e-branch quest. Each e-branch's first quest is unaffected by this timer - it always takes 1-10 days to occur.
LanguageData.HVMP_SettingMaxDays: Max days between random e-branch quests
LanguageData.HVMP_TooltipMaxDays: Each e-branch periodically offers a quest to the player. This is the maximum amount of time it takes to receive an e-branch quest. Each e-branch's first quest is unaffected by this timer - it always takes 1-10 days to occur.
LanguageData.HVMP_TooltipRewardFactor:
Multiplies the amount of standing and/or goodwill you gain with an e-branch by completing any one of their quests.
By default, the rewards for most e-branch quests are usually 3-5 standing or 14-17 goodwill.
At minimum, rewards are usually 2-3 standing or 11-12 goodwill.
At maximum, rewards are usually 5-7 standing or 17-25 goodwill.
LanguageData.HVMP_TooltipExpectationLevel:
You will lose goodwill with e-branches when you refuse or fail one of their quests, ONLY IF you have a colony with enough wealth to have expectations of the selected level or higher.

Select "Inactive" to disable this entirely.
-If this and the other goodwill penalty setting are both inactive, goodwill loss will not occur.
-If this is inactive but the other one is active, goodwill loss occurs if the other setting's condition is met.
-If both are active, goodwill loss will occur only when both conditions are met.
LanguageData.HVMP_TooltipSeniorityLevel:
You will lose goodwill with e-branches when you refuse or fail one of their quests, ONLY IF you have a pawn with a title from that e-branch of the selected level or higher.

Select "Inactive" to disable this entirely.
-If this and the other goodwill penalty setting are both inactive, goodwill loss will not occur.
-If this is inactive but the other one is active, goodwill loss occurs if the other setting's condition is met.
-If both are active, goodwill loss will occur only when both conditions are met.
LanguageData.HVMP_TooltipGoodwillRefusal:
If you fulfill either the 'minimum expectation' or 'minimum title' conditions set above, you will lose this much goodwill whenever you let an e-branch quest expire without accepting it. You also lose this much goodwill if an e-branch was prevented from sending a quest due to you toggling off its goodwill or standing rewards in the Rewards Preferences menu of your Quests tab.

If both a minimum expectation and title have been selected, both conditions must be fulfilled.

Changing this value will only affect the penalty for FUTURE quests, not ones that have already been generated.
LanguageData.HVMP_TooltipGoodwillFailure:
If you fulfill either the 'minimum expectation' or 'minimum title' conditions set above, you will lose this much goodwill whenever you fail an accepted e-branch quest.

If both a minimum expectation and title have been selected, both conditions must be fulfilled.

Changing this value will only affect the penalty for FUTURE quests, not ones that have already been generated.
LanguageData.HVMP_SettingAnomalyActivityLevel: Occult Branch can always be encountered
LanguageData.HVMP_TooltipAnomalyActivityLevel: By default, the Occult Branch will only show up after the monolith has been activated (if using the standard Anomaly playstyle), have its frequency of contact multiplied by the anomaly activity level (if using Ambient Horror), or otherwise not be active at all.\n\nIf you enable this setting, they will not be subject to these rules, instead appearing as frequently as other e-branches.
LanguageData.HVMP_TooltipBranchPlatformInterval: The rate at which new branch platforms appear in orbit. Spawning occurs at the same time and the same rate for all e-branch factions. Each e-branch can only gain one platform per spawning incidence, even if they would need more than one platform to reach their limit.
LanguageData.HVMP_TooltipBranchPlatformLimit: An e-branch faction will not spawn new platforms in orbit if it already has this many platforms.
LanguageData.HVMP_TooltipBranchPlatformDefenders: Scales the number of defenders generated for each e-branch platform. The higher this number, the harder the fight.\n\nSetting this to higher numbers may significantly extend the time it takes for a platform map to load, and may also make the fight a very long, difficult slog.
LanguageData.HVMP_SettingAuthorizerCooldown: Permit authorizer cooldown per standing cost
LanguageData.HVMP_TooltipAuthorizerCooldown: Once a permit authorizer is used to use a permit from a hostile e-branch, it can't be used to do this again for a number of days equal to [the permit's standing cost] times [this value].
LanguageData.HVMP_TooltipAuthorizerStandingGain: Implanting a permit authorizer grants this much standing with its e-branch.
LanguageData.HVMP_ErrorNoQuestsFoundForBranch: Tried to give an e-branch quest from {0}, but their e-branch quest list is empty
LanguageData.HVMP_ErrorNoUsableBranchQuests: Tried to give an e-branch quest from {0}, but none of their quests' prerequisites are met and so cannot fire.
LanguageData.HVMP_TraderBlockedCaravan: A trade caravan would have appeared at this time, but as per a prior agreement you made with the Commerce Branch, they have been diverted.
LanguageData.HVMP_TraderBlockedOrbital: An orbital trade ship would have made contact at this time, but as per a prior agreement you made with the Commerce Branch, they have been diverted.
LanguageData.HVMP_TraderBlocksRemainingNone: This was the last trader you agreed to let the Commerce Branch block.
LanguageData.HVMP_TraderBlocksRemaining: The Commerce Branch will still block {0} more trader(s). They would like to thank you for your patience and understanding.
LanguageData.HVMP_TooDeepToReach: The signal is obstructed by tons of overhead earth. You cannot contact the {0} at this time.
LanguageData.HVMP_Representative: A {0} representative greets you with practiced courtesy.
LanguageData.HVMP_QuestAnomalyInactive: No quests available due to current lack of anomalous activity
LanguageData.HVMP_QuestCooldown: Cannot request another quest from any e-branch for {0} days
LanguageData.HVMP_NeedTitle: {0} must have the trust of the {1}
LanguageData.HVMP_GotQuest: The {0} has issued you a new quest.
LanguageData.HVMP_RefreshedPermitCDs: The {0} has refreshed its permits' cooldowns for the {1}.
LanguageData.HVMP_TargetCurrency: Only usable on currency (silver or gold)
LanguageData.HVMP_TargetDesertion: Only usable on mentally unbroken enemies sapient enough to be bribed
LanguageData.HVMP_TargetRecruitment: Only usable on mentally unbroken prisoners
LanguageData.HVMP_TargetIngratiation: Only usable on mentally unbroken individuals from a faction capable of diplomacy
LanguageData.HVMP_NoFactionCanSendRaids: There are no factions that can send raids
LanguageData.HVMP_CommandCallRoyalAidTradersBlocked: The {FACTION_name} is preventing you from receiving traders. Remaining blocks: {0}
LanguageData.HVMP_NoFactionCanSendTraders: There are no factions that can send trading caravans
LanguageData.HVMP_NoSenatorsLeftToBribe: You have the favor of all current senators
LanguageData.HVMP_TargetToGood: Only usable on non-artifact, non-artwork, non-building items below good-quality
LanguageData.HVMP_TargetToExc: Only usable on non-artifact, non-artwork, non-building items below excellent-quality
LanguageData.HVMP_TargetToMaster: Only usable on non-artifact, non-artwork, non-building items below masterwork-quality
LanguageData.HVMP_TargetToLegendary: Only usable on masterwork, non-artifact, non-artwork, non-building items of masterwork quality
LanguageData.HVMP_TargetDamaged: Only usable on damaged items or buildings
LanguageData.HVMP_TargetDamagedOrTainted: Only uasble on damaged, tainted, or broken-down items or buildings
LanguageData.HVMP_TargetTMD: Target must be suffering from a mechanite disease
LanguageData.HVMP_CommandCallRoyalAidMapTooWatery: Cannot drill a geothermal vent in this area.
LanguageData.HVMP_TooCloseToGeyser: Drill must not be too close to another drill or existing steam geyser.
LanguageData.HVMP_PoorTerrainForGeyser: Drill must be placed on a wide stretch of diggable ground suitable for heavy structures.
LanguageData.HVMP_WaterUnsuitableForFish: Hatchery cannot function in a body of water incapable of supporting a fish population.
LanguageData.HVMP_NoWaterForFish: Hatchery must be placed on a body of water capable of supporting a fish population.
LanguageData.HVMP_TooCloseToHatchery: Hatchery must not be too close to another hatchery.
LanguageData.HVMP_BadSkipSpot: Cannot teleport into an obstructed space
LanguageData.HVMP_CaravanAssistance: The {FACTION_name} has marked the target for caravan assistance.
LanguageData.HVMP_MessagePermitAnimal: The {FACTION_name} has deployed their remote animal pulser weapon at the requested location.
LanguageData.HVMP_MessagePermitChiller: The {FACTION_name} has deployed their climate-cooling weapon at the requested location. It will last for 3 days.
LanguageData.HVMP_MessagePermitEMI: The {FACTION_name} has deployed their EMI weapon at the requested location. It will last for 1 day.
LanguageData.HVMP_MessagePermitScorcher: The {FACTION_name} has deployed their climate-warming weapon at the requested location. It will last for 3 days.
LanguageData.HVMP_MessagePermitSunBlocker: The {FACTION_name} has deployed their sun-blocker weapon at the requested location. It will last for 3 days.
LanguageData.HVMP_MessagePermitFallout: The {FACTION_name} has deployed their toxic vapor weapon at the requested location. It will last for 3 days.
LanguageData.HVMP_MessageMechCluster: The {FACTION_name} has agitated the mechanoid hive, which will deploy a mech cluster shortly.
LanguageData.HVMP_MessagePermitRScan: The {FACTION_name} has deployed their revealing scanner at the requested location.
LanguageData.HVMP_InvestmentMade: The {FACTION_name} has collected the funding for your investment.
LanguageData.HVMP_InvestmentReturns: The fruits of your investment with the {FACTION_name} have returned.
LanguageData.HVMP_Desertion: {PAWN_nameDef} has taken the bribe offered by the {FACTION_name} and will now retreat.
LanguageData.HVMP_Recruitment: {PAWN_nameDef} has taken the bribe offered by the {FACTION_name} and is now more amenable to working with you.
LanguageData.HVMP_Ingratiation: The bribe offered by the {FACTION_name} to the faction of {PAWN_nameDef} has gone through, improving your goodwill with them.
LanguageData.HVMP_Peacemaking: All present hostiles have taken the bribe offered by the {FACTION_name} and will now retreat.
LanguageData.HVMP_SenatorBribed: The {FACTION_name} has bribed a senator on your behalf.
LanguageData.HVMP_QualityBoostRisky: The {FACTION_name} has made its attempt to improve the item's quality to legendary.
LanguageData.HVMP_ScannerSweep: The {FACTION_name}'s penetrative scanning technology has provided an image of the targeted area.
LanguageData.HVMP_ScannerDeep: The {FACTION_name}'s penetrative scanning technology has found a lump of buried {0}!
LanguageData.HVMP_RelicDiscovered: Analyzing the contents of their libraries, the {0} has discovered the existence of a relic of {1}.
LanguageData.HVMP_UsePermitHediffGizmoDesc: Call for aid using a special permit.\n\nEach permit costs a certain number of charges, which can be regained by implanting more permit targeters.
LanguageData.HVMP_ProbabilityTunerActivated: The probability tuner affixed to {PAWN_nameDef} has activated, and subsequently disintegrated.
LanguageData.HVMP_CCompToggleUpTooltip: Increases power consumption by 100W/d. This enhances computation progress by 0.1% per hour.\n\nThe chaincomputer can handle up to 5000W/d of external power, which would boost its progress by +5% per hour. However, while externally powered, it outputs signals which can attract hostile parties.
LanguageData.HVMP_CCompToggleDownTooltip: Lowers power consumption by 100W/d. This reduces computation progress by 0.1% per hour.\n\nThe chaincomputer can operate without any external power, but it will be very slow.
LanguageData.HVMP_BookProgress1: Revision speed scales with these skills:
LanguageData.HVMP_AtlasDesc: An atlas of a nearby region. It's somewhat antiquated, and will take time to update for contemporary accuracy.
LanguageData.HVMP_NeverBeenToAtlasPoint: hasn't been to the area it describes
LanguageData.HVMP_EnigmaStats: Study speed scales with the following stats:
LanguageData.HVMP_ShuttleArriveAnthro: Shuttle arriving after {0} questions asked by anthropologists
LanguageData.HVMP_ShuttleArriveAnthroDesc: A shuttle will arrive after {1} questions have been asked by the anthropologists. The quest {0} requires you to load the following people or items onto the shuttle before it leaves:\n{2}
LanguageData.HVMP_ShuttleArriveAnthroDescHidden: A shuttle will arrive after {0} questions have been asked by the anthropologists.
LanguageData.HVMP_ShuttleAnthroInspectString: Departing on shuttle after {0} questions have been asked
LanguageData.HVMP_ShuttleAnthroArrivesOn: Shuttle arrives after anthropologists' inquiries are resolved, consisting of {0} questions
LanguageData.HVMP_AncientTerminalDiscovered: You've discovered an ancient terminal with valuable information!
LanguageData.HVMP_DroneArrivedText: The spacedrone has arrived. It is guarded by mechanoids.
LanguageData.HVMP_DroneHacked: You've finished hacking the {0} on behalf of the Archive Branch.
LanguageData.HVMP_NeopathyCureDiscovered: By studying and tending to {PAWN_nameDef}, a cure has been found for {PAWN_possessive} malady!
LanguageData.HVMP_QuestPartShuttleArriveOnCure: Shuttle arrives when neopathy is cured
LanguageData.HVMP_QuestPartShuttleArriveOnCureDesc: A shuttle will arrive once the neopathy is cured. The quest {0} requires you to load the following people or items onto the shuttle before it leaves:\n{1}
LanguageData.HVMP_PreserveDestroyedBecauseOfViolation: The nature preserve has been destroyed due to artificial constructions or pollution within its bounds.
LanguageData.HVMP_AlertPreserveViolationDesc: Pollution, flooring, or an artificial building has been detected inside one of your nature preserves. It will be destroyed in {0}.
LanguageData.HVMP_RetroviralHediff: The retroviral agent caused {0_nameDef} to develop a condition: {1}.
LanguageData.HVMP_RetroviralItem: The retroviral agent caused {0_nameDef} to produce an item: {1}.
LanguageData.HVMP_RetroviralGainedGene: The retroviral agent caused {0_nameDef} to gain the {1} gene.
LanguageData.HVMP_RetroviralRemovedGene: The retroviral agent caused {0_nameDef} to lose the {1} gene.
LanguageData.HVMP_WokeOccult: The enigmatic psychic sciences employed by the Occult Branch have awakened {PAWN_nameDef} to {PAWN_possessive} psychic potential!
LanguageData.HVMP_WokeOccultF: The secret arcane rituals employed by the Occult Branch have awakened {PAWN_nameDef} to {PAWN_possessive} sorcerous potential!
LanguageData.HVMP_LovecraftTooSoon: to wait at least one day since the last psychic discharge. Remaining time: {0}
LanguageData.HVMP_LovecraftManhunterText: A roiling wave of psychic energy has swept over the landscape. It seems many of the animals in the area have been driven insane.
LanguageData.HVMP_LetterObeliskDiscovered: {PAWN_nameDef} has discovered a large obelisk. In between its twisting prongs, {PAWN_pronoun} catches fleeting synesthetic impressions of different locations across the planet. Perhaps it can be activated to return {PAWN_objective} home.\n\nSelect {PAWN_nameDef} and right-click the obelisk to activate it.
LanguageData.HVMP_PaxTalksBackfire: The talks have backfired. Despite trading some pleasantries, no progress was made, and multiple statements were interpreted as insults.
LanguageData.HVMP_PaxTalksFlounder: The talks floundered. Delegates managed to communicate clearly and with basic respect, but nothing was achieved.
LanguageData.HVMP_PaxTalksSuccess: The talks were a success. The delegates reached a new level of mutual understanding and respect for each others' people.
LanguageData.HVMP_InspiringVerseHitsRight: Thanks to reading {0}, {1} has experienced an inspiration!
LanguageData.HVMP_IdeoBookHediffGain: Per hour of reading: grants {0} stacks of the "{1}" buff to believers, lasting for {2} hours
LanguageData.HVMP_ChargecellIsForMechs: Target must have an energy meter
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_QuestMutators: If you feel like a particular quest type is too easy, you can use the modifiers below to make it more difficult. Changes in this menu only apply to future quests, not those that have already been generated.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_MayhemMode: If enabled, disabled mutators still have a 35% chance to apply to any quest of this type.
LanguageData.HVMP_HardMode_Tooltip_Fortification_1: Raids may have an additional contingent of robotic combatants (such as centipedes or Odyssey's wasp drones). Otherwise, their arrival will be accompanied by 2-5 hours of an EMI field, psychic drone, or lesser psychic suppression which only affects you and your allies.
LanguageData.HVMP_HardMode_Tooltip_Fortification_2: Some raiders are "raiding scouts", marked by a red symbol above their heads. Any raiding scout that escapes will grant up to four hostile factions an additional cache of "raid points" which they can spend to empower their future raids.
LanguageData.HVMP_HardMode_Tooltip_Fortification_3: Raids have an additional contingent of industrial-tech mercenaries. Some raiders may have a protective mechanite coating, and a few may have a special red shield that makes them slower but can absorb a very high amount of damage (of any kind, even melee or EMP).
LanguageData.HVMP_HardMode_Tooltip_Intervention_1: Upon accepting the quest, every non-insectoid pawn on the map receives "deepscan burn" for 24 hours, inflicting +30% pain and -6 mood. Deepscan burn elapses faster on pawns with higher toxic environment resistance. Wild, tameable animals affected by the burn flee the map.
LanguageData.HVMP_HardMode_Tooltip_Intervention_2: Insectoids may inflict scaria with their bites or claws.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Mastermind: Agree to not encounter the next trade caravan or orbital trader that would visit you.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Research: Take care of a "chaincomputer" device until it finishes its calculations.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Caelum: Endure a lengthy forced game condition, such as a heat wave.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Mundi: Improve your goodwill with other factions.
LanguageData.HVMP_HardMode_Label_Mundi_3: Stray Not From the Narrow Path
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Populus: Take care of some refugees for several days. A raid might pursue them.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Vox: Succeed at peace talks with a "minor faction".
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Atlas: Revise a dated atlas. Only those who have been to a specific point on the world map can revise it.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Colossus: Erect a large building. You may also be tasked to keep it safe for a while after completion.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Laelaps: Send colonists on a shuttle to assist someone else for several days.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Odyssey: Visit multiple points on the world map.
LanguageData.HVMP_HardMode_Label_Odyssey_1: Around the World in 4.8 Million Ticks
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Theseus: Send colonists on a shuttle to destroy a bandit camp.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Entrant: Journey to a shuttle crash site and deconstruct the shuttle.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Ethnography: Take care of some anthropologists until they've asked all their questions.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Excavation: Hack all the terminals in an ancient complex.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Extraterrestrial: Hack a crashed spacedrone. It is guarded by mechs which are initially dormant.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_CaseStudy: Take care of Patient Zero of a new disease, until you discover and administer the cure. New symptoms of the disease appear over time.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_ECquest: Journey to and destroy a problem causer outpost. It is guarded by mechanoids.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_FieldWork: Keep an area of your choice - a "nature preserve" - clear of pollution, structures, and floors.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_HazardDisposal: Fight a manhunter pack that has been empowered by a random mutation.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_RAquest: Study a gene-engineering package, or just inject it into someone to witness its effects firsthand. Injection may have negative outcomes, and rarely has positive ones.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Fuller: Keep some Horaxian cultists as prisoners. At least one cultist raid will attempt to free them.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Lovecraft: Endure a random psychic or atmospheric condition. You do not know what the condition is until you accept the quest. Most, but not all, possible conditions are negative.
LanguageData.HVMP_Tooltip_Natali: Travel to a bubble of warped space on the world map, then escape the labyrinth within.
